39468569.review: Deep political commentary. I like it.

39276430.review:
I really enjoy this! It's a bit like Downwell. The goals is to protect a falling bomb/ship from hamster thingies. You get upgrades after you die. Its a rogue-lite? 

The game is pleasantly forgiving and just challenging enough to be entertaining. It's mainly a battle of not falling past the bottom of the level. 

Nice retro effects, smooth gameplay. +unlimited framerate. unfortunately no ultrawide support. 

Works with DS4 really well! Recommended at this price for sure.

38596975.review:
This is a very fun little game about getting high score. The main premise is to survive as long as you can, while protecting the huge bomb that is slowly moving downwards all the time and that is usually attacked by molemen. Remember - one hit and you're dead (there is an armor power up that adds you one additional Hit Point mind you).

Pros:
- groovy music
- fun pixel art graphics with a VHS filter option
- lots of guns and power ups
- it's just fun to play

Cons:
- there is no other end than game over, it's just an arcade game about getting a high score

Well, I really do recommend this fun little game as it's really relaxing to play and allows you to Git Gud and improve over time.

38535600.review:
Muy buen juego y más a su precio reducido; buena jugabilidad, excelentes gráficos y buenos efectos de sonido. Por poner un pero,la machacona melodía y el no muy suave scroll de pantalla,incluso reduciendo la resolución.
Muy entretenido. Un 7

33739097.review: Two thumbs up! Really charming experience - and I'm looking forward to it being a time-killer while I listen to podcasts. Excited to see what the developers produce next.

33457547.review: Cheaper than a cup of bad coffee, and far more enjoyable.

31250970.review:
(I know the review is shit but I needed to reflect what I am)
Molemen Must Die.

What a hectic game. You can barely take your eyes of the sceen for a second unless you want to be eaten or drilled by those little fluffy bastards. I think thats why I love this game so much. Anyway, why would you want to look away from such a beautiful pleasing game such as this. (Cue the internet where you can't have an opinion.) I do believe that MMD needs a chainsaw, but who knows what the future holds. Devs are also very sociable, but one gets ready to early. Was ready before midnight once, still dissapointed in him.

So, should you buy this game for yourself, grandma and dog?

Absolutely. Whilst the dog might not get very high on the leaderboard and ya granny might have a heart attack, who cares? They get to enjoy a great game. Even if they die.

31227857.review: A must-have for all fans of Downwell! I love it.

30993932.review:
NOTE: This game was given to me by the developer for review purposes. This did not influence my review in any way.

[h1]==========================================================
---------------------------------------OVERVIEW-------------------------------------
==========================================================[/h1]
Molemen Must Die! is a frantic falling platform shooter from new indie developer, Mokomoto.

Each game starts with King Moleman assaulting the American president and the president replying immediately by releasing a huge bomb down into the moleman tunnels. You play an unnamed female soldier whose task is to accompany the bomb downwards, fending off moleman defenders until, presumably, the bomb reaches the bottom and destroys moleman civilisation forever. (I haven't got anywhere near that far yet.)

[h1]==========================================================
----------------------------------------QUALITY-------------------------------------
==========================================================[/h1]
Graphics - The graphics in Molemen Must Die! are pixel graphics with a good dosing of personality, although they can be somewhat hard to discern on occasion; I wasn't sure of the protagonist's gender until she was killed for the first time.

The molemen come in a number of shapes, sizes, colours, and abilities, and generally look cute, if deadly. And weapons and special effects are nicely done, with pixels flying everywhere, though bullets are rather large in comparison to the characters.

There are no graphics quality settings; full-screen/windowed mode, resolution, and a 'VHS' filter that makes the game look like it's played on an old TV are all that is included. (I turned this filter off immediately.)

Sound - Sound is repetitive, but good. There are only two music tracks, I think, but both of them fit the frantic game play. Weapon sounds and explosions are good and normalised for volume, and the protagonist's scream when she dies is a fine end to the game's action.

I'm in two minds as to whether less is more in this case, or whether the game would be better if there were a lot of crazy, gibbering, mole-men sounds as well. Regardless, what's here now works well.

Gameplay - Molemen Must Die! is played as a side-on two-dimensional action platformer. The giant bomb that you are protecting falls continuously down the screen, keeping the action moving downwards. If you touch the top of the screen of fall off the bottom then you die. If a moleman hits you (once), you get shot (once), or you're caught by a mole device or explosion (once), then you die. The goal really is to last as long as you can before the inevitable happens, amassing points for dealing out crazy moleman death as much as you can.

The molemen aren't just gunning for you, though. If you don't kill them quickly enough, they'll jump onto the giant bomb and flail away at it, gradually decreasing its health. If that gets to zero then you guessed it: you die.

Controller controls are simple, with left stick moving you around, A button jumping, X button shooting, and RT to use your rare super bombs, that destroy all moles on the screen. If you're insane (or you don't have a controller, I suppose), you can play with the keyboard, but controller is definitely best.

In a stroke of genius, the developers added an element of randomness in the form of active effects. You have three active effects at any one time (once you've played your third game, at least). At the start of each game the oldest effect drops off and a random new one takes its place. Each effect thus lasts for three games. You have no choice in these effects, and they range from truly excellent (a gun that shoots both left and right at once), to the weird (a rainbow trail that does nothing useful), to the downright annoying (huge molemen, or faster spawning molemen). They can thus change the difficulty significantly between games, and add a good dose of variation to what is otherwise a fairly repetitive game.

Each game you start off with your trusty semi-automatic pistol. Stay with this too long, though, and your thumb will get very sore and tired from pressing the 'X' button. Luckily, random weapon drops are fairly frequent, although somewhat limited in choice, at least to begin with.

As you kill molemen, they drop little XP orbs. Pick up enough of these and you gain a level, which seems to have only one effect: unlocking a new weapon. So the more you play, the more variation you'll see in weapons when you play again. I don't know how many weapons and thus levels are in the game, but so far I've seen machine guns, miniguns, rocket launchers, firebombs, homing missiles, shotguns, and mines, I think.

[h1]==========================================================
-------------------------------------PROS & CONS------------------------------------
==========================================================[/h1]
Pros:
+ A good sense of humour
+ Good controller response; I didn't often feel that the controls were to blame for my failure
+ Mostly nice pixel graphics and good sound
+ The three random active effects add some variation and replayability
+ Leaderboard and silly messages displayed after each game
+ Steam Achievements and Trading Cards

Cons:
- Not enough weapon variation, at least in the early game
- It's sometimes hard to see what's going on


[h1]==========================================================
--------------------------------------CONCLUSION-----------------------------------
==========================================================[/h1]

Molemen Must Die! is a great first entry for Mokomoto on Steam. It has just the right amounts of addictiveness and randomness, and its gameplay is very frantic, but lots of fun. It's a simple game, but therein lies its appeal.

[h1]7/10[/h1]

[code]For more recommendations by LL's Game Giveaways and Reviews on quality indie games or ones with high potential follow our group curations [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10405952/]here[/url]![/code]

30978502.review: This game is a blast! Use your twitch reflexes to shoot molemen and carefully make your way down into their world, escorting a genuine U.S of A nuke all the way. Now I just need to get my mojo back and regain top spot on the leaderboard!

30904664.review:
So much fun! I'm not normally into fast-paced shooter games, but its just the right combination of platformer and shooter for me. Reminds me a lot of joust but with more action. The controls work well even on a keyboard, but I definately wanna try it with a controller soon instead. Maybe default the spacebar to jump instead of the up key. One thing to add would be a better bullet counter for limited ammo - it took me a while to figure out that yellow gauge was showing my limit. Something flashier would be better. An "easy mode" with 3 lives would be a bonus too.

Absolutely worth picking up!

30901066.review: a fun as hell arcadey shootey game with fluid controls and satisfying weapons and upgrades. character and level modifiers make it constantly interesting to replay and the implementation of the leaderboard gives a nice sense of progression, definitely more than worth the money

30900776.review: Pretty visceral. Kind of wacky to start with for example the character is not that agile, but they are super gunned up with "heavy bullets" modifer that just makes all the bullets heavy, "bouncey bullets" and "shoot both directions"... and you're shooting all kinds of moles and vaping up XP, but that's also what makes it good. Good one to jump into for 10-15 minutes after work or something and there will be a bit of variety each time.

30894456.review:
I'd been watching this game during development and thought it looked like fun if you like its particular brand of insanity, but I didn't think I'd be interesting because usually I'm no good at games that require me to think and move fast. I'd always intended to buy it though because I wanted to support game devs in my city, so I grabbed a copy during the first week.

To my great surprise, I'm actually not too bad it! If you can see past the frantic madness (and every MMD video you've seen is 100% accurate on that score), you can do quite well by pacing yourself, not being distracted and have a strategy for each enemy type and platform layout.

I'm an old C64 gamer from way back, so the retro soundtrack and graphics style tickles every nostaligic bone in my body (and the crappy-VCR filter is _magnificent_ and I hope every 8-bit emulator adopts it).

Basically, I can't fault it for what it is. I'm playing it nearly every day in short bursts. As a highly entertaining timewaster you can't go far wrong at this price!

30868533.review:
Really enjoyed this game! Reminded me a lot of Downwell. Very fun and fast.

Check out my Indie Impression: https://youtu.be/B5Xuo9Gy4hY

30806761.review:
An American power fantasy, this game involves Trump seeking revenge on the [strike] Mexicans [/strike] Molemen who insulted his presidency.  You will jump down an endless hole, experiencing a near bullet hell as you mow down cute munchkin moles. You'll also have to escort a [strike] wall [/strike] bomb to the centre of the planet before it blows.

Being an old-skool 8-bit platformer, half the things you'll stand on will be steel beams. Ordinarily, this would be an over-played trope. In this case however, i think it's an excellent opportunity for further satire.

[b] I would like to officially petition the devs to implement the cheat code 'Jetfuel', or perhaps as a random drop. It could be a bucket of jet fuel that you pour on a steel beam to melt it and everything under it, creating a drop chute straight to the final battle where we can be immediately minced by the Mole Cartel King. [/b]


Overall, I’d give this a many thumbs up out of a sea of thumbs up. One can never kill too many molemen, nor protect the ego of a cheeto with tiny hands.

30786250.review:
If you've ever played the awesome free indie game Super Crate Box, Molemen Must Die! will be immediayely familiar. It takes that general idea - 2D platformer, survive as long as you can against waves of enemies, collect a variety of guns - and turns it up to 11. For one thing, it's always on the move: you have to escort a bomb down toward the centre of the earth, and its slow progress ensures that you're never fighting on the same set of platforms for very long. Every time you die, a random modifier is applied, so the game gets very chaotic very quickly. And the guns! Oh, the guns. So many guns.

If you want a genuinely pulse-raising game experience you can enjoy in just a few minutes, or play for hours on end without ever seeing the same scenario twice, buy this game NOW.

30768918.review:
For the small price of a disgusting, greasy, burger that will only further your descent into the inavoidable embrace of death, you too can enjoy the thrill of killing many mole people.

Scientist say that klling mole people may prolong your life expectancy by as much as 1 day per mole person, and at the end of the day, isn't that you can ask from a vidgame?

Be the you, you want to be. Play now and help rid the world of one of the last great threats to our society, Mole people.

 Namaste and good hunting friend (Unless you are a mole person).

30702656.review: It's pretty damn fun. The effects are great, and the powerups are a lot of fun.

30698763.review: Would definitely recommend for such a low price!

30697573.review:
Molemen Must Die is hectic and a whole lot of fun. I've seen it at a couple of points through development/beta tester, and the finished product is really polished. I really love the sound design and visual aesthetic, like old-school arcade but with retrofuture tones. 

Gameplay is challenging and at the right kind of level for this kind of game, I get better with each run, and the different weapons and enemy types mix things up to keep play interesting. I'm looking forward to trying to get onto the leaderboards

30687461.review:
Really fun game. i like the design of it and the concept. large explosions and non stop action make this game worth the 2.50 i got it for. it would be even better with a 2 player mode.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BzCSfW3gU9o&feature=youtu.be

30676833.review:
I have been excited for the release of this little gem and it certainly did not disappoint. This is a really fun “pick up and jump right in” kind of game where you could spend any amount of time playing. The global leader board has you testing your skills against other players and yourself keeping you coming back for that “just one more go” run. The power-up load outs switch the game up immensely, which was something I wasn’t quit expecting but really enjoy, from ricocheting bullets, more enemies, explosive landings plus many more. There is also good selection of weapons to utilize on your decent into chaos, from machine guns to homing rockets. 
I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes action/arcade score chasers and for the cost of the game, you really can’t go wrong .

30675638.review:
This game's premise is a political commentary, which I only discovered well after getting into it. In other words, you don't have to know what's really going on, just enjoy blowing the !@#$ out of everything.
The Machine Gun is my favourite power-up, especially when I'm shooting out from both ends. Gameplay starts to get hectic after a few playthroughs, but all the shooting, killing and explosions, coupled with a surprisingly fitting sountrack, make for an exhilarating experience.
I recommend a controller for this game, even though I'm usually a keyboard enthusiast.

30675250.review: Highly addictive retro style game. Fast paced action keeps the game interesting. It's a must have game.

I believe the aim of the game is to keep jumping down to prevent the Molemen from arming the bomb or something. You shoot waves of them until eventually you succumb to the tedium of the task at hand, or you're just overrun and lose. That's it.

It's not for me. It's not bad, it just isn't for me. I'm not so sure any of my Steam friends would dig it either. 

I did only play it for 10 minutes, so maybe I didn't give a chance. Be that as it may, I paid for it, and I'm probably not going to play it again, so this'll have to do.

30669744.review:
I feel the need for revenge! This is a fun endless game with global leader boards. Each run is unique as you're given a new power up each time, with 3 at a time. I wouldn't mind a daily mode with fixed power ups so I could compete with more skill instead of randomness. I still had a lot of fun seeing how far I could get.

30664593.review: Quirky platformer with a satirical political twist, this one was a good laugh. Found it challenging and the range of colourful weaponry was epic. Would highly recommend! Especially with the affordable price tag.

30661896.review: Overall a pretty fun and addictive platformer, abilities switch up the gameplay and lots of pew pew pew guns

30661827.review:
Molemen Must Die! plays similarly to something like Super Crate Box but the level is continuously changing and scrolling downwards to the pits of the Molemen lair. It's one hit and you're out unless you managed to pickup an armour powerup. The game encourages you to play again after each playthrough so you can continue to unlock new weapons as well as encouraging you to beat the next closest person on the leaderboard.

I'm personally not a fan of the "VHS filter" but the game has included options to turn this off as well as configuring other settings like rebinding controls (I recommend a controller for this game although it is definitely playable and accessible with a keyboard).

For $3, this is a fun arcade game to challenge friends together on the leaderboard.

30661803.review:
Molemen Must Die! is a game of chaos, and control. Whilst it may look to be another platformer on the surface - the goal of having to escort the bomb (which is thankfully resiliant), and learning to master your power-up loadout provides quite the test on the formula.

Especially when it adds to the general chaos of gameplay.

If you're a fan of action platformers, twitch experiences, or mastering skill through chaos, it's one you absolutely would enjoy!

30661140.review:
Feels like the platforming controls are straight out of a Unity asset store platformer plugin along with the screen tearing which felt like it was just there because the developer thought it was a cool $15 add on as it serves no real puprouse besides muddying up the games aesthetic.

It's a bit confusing what power ups the game decides to assign you (looks like it's random?). There was a 'heavy weapon' mod added to my character which stayed through a few play throughs and made it look like she was peeing when shooting. Might have been a poor attempt to handle the fact there's no way to aim with the gun which only shoots sideways in a platformer focused on downwards movement.

I enjoyed how terribly executed America focused political satire was, it mostly misses the mark unless the developer was deliberately going for shitty poorly executed satire. Trumps election must have been a huge relief for this games developer.


Pretty fun on the whole though if you like throw away games like this.

30661038.review:
I thoroughly enjoyed testing this game. The concept is simple enough yet incredibly challenging forcing it to become second nature to make small gains. That said the perk system is brilliant allowing you to push forward in new ways.

When you get a good set of perks and weapons and let lose the carnage is just beautiful, I highly recommend checking this out if you enjoy games like Binding of Issac for challenging fast paced action. It's great value so give it a go :)

30660951.review:
This game is suprising Fun! Molemen Must Die is a really quirky game with explosion of guts across your screen. The weaponary and unique Power Up  add a crazy amount of CHAOS and FUN to this neat little game. 

PS DO NOT let the VHS visual effect deter you, it is easily disabled!!!! :)
